column4: Suddenly I've lost all audio playback.. been working for several releases including 9.10 then it just stopped.  even aplay won't play anything.. Any diagnostic advice?
alsaplay , make sure nothing is muted by default ...also trying killing pulseaudio

Switch10 been there done all that.. including killing pulse.. all levels are fine and worked day before yesterday.. no changes other than some updates to the system.. alsaplay is actually aplay from cli .. and no go with that either.
analog but there is a digital option.. when I choose that the system reports that it won't work
at any rate .. I'm using analog lines.
driving me nuts..
not sure .. how do I check for what's loaded and what shouldn't be?
lsmod | simply gives me a > symbol
ah
lsmod | grep snd | pastebinit results in http://pastebin.com/f43e5b937
gforce 8200 on an XFX board
hummmm... I wonder how that happened.. let me check the board specs and see which one it should be..
looks like sound is Realtek ALC 888 codec 8 channel HD audio..
how do I  remove the offending driver?
rmmod
rmmod *nameofmodule
would it be "sudo rmmod snd_hda_intel" ??
correct
with sudo?
will more than likely have to use sudo
^^what erSUL said
says the module is in use.. killall pulseaudio?
